page.title: 11THE OLD BREWERY,FENSTANTON
page.content: { The Brewery}is an old house in {High Street.}It was built in{1850, } but before that they used to brew at Hall Green Farm, but only for 2 years. {The water supply}came from 2 wells,one behind the Brewery, 25 metres deep,the other in Swan Lane. {John Coote}first had the Brewery and then sold it to{Robert Odhams. In{1860}his son took over and later sold the building to{R.W.Flick.}In 1887,he sold it to{H.J.Burt.} { } There was a big fire in{1901}so they stopped producing beer.Then the Brewery was used as a bottling depot. In{1906}it was sold and converted into a house. In{1899}1 gallon of the best beer was sold at 1/6d which is about 10pence in our money.Today a pint cost at least 70p. {
